comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: Beautiful picture of very elegant and privileged people!  The babies were quite alert and probably some months old by then, unusual to delay the baptism so long given the level of child mortality.  The lady's dresses are so elegant and reminiscent of the period and the Rev. gentlemans attire and moustache match the scene.  Another one to make our Movember wannabees green with envy!

comment.author: 32149975@N07
comment._content: The ladies look very trim even with very young babies! Lovely photos!

comment.author: 63844591@N04
comment._content:
NLI,
Sion Lodge and Sion Hill houses both overlook the river Suir in Waterford, immediately to the north of the words Dock Road on the map on this page. OS map show them clearly

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/63844591@N04] Brilliant! Thank you. I've moved it, so you might like to cast an eye at the map again just to make sure...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 63844591@N04
comment._content: NLI, perfect. Sorry to be so pedantic. my main focus is history DG47

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/63844591@N04] You are not pedantic at all! I don't want to have inaccurate locations all over the place, and that'd be the case without all of you and your "up a bit", "left a bit", "no, no, back down a bit"... So, thank you again, and hope you will continue putting your history skills to work around here.
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
